Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery kotyle; interior: glazed black (only traces remaining); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of possibly part of animal's belly; below, three bands above three rays (and part of a fourth); below, single band; band on inner and outer face of foot; underside: one central dot, two pairs of circles and one band.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.1159 and belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201,1171.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.077) (Phase 1)
